messages.author: Jered
messages.text: Do you still want to call Submit() here?

messages.author: Jered
messages.text: I still think this is weird. I'd prefer to use navigatecontentwindow() with no URL---it always shows at 100% height and commits, and all suggestions call it (just queries have no associated URLs).

messages.author: samarth
messages.text:
On 2012/12/11 16:43:48, Jered wrote:
> Do you still want to call Submit() here?

Yes, actually the submit is needed here to commit the suggestion which was set using setValue().

messages.author: samarth
messages.text:
On 2012/12/11 16:43:48, Jered wrote:
> I still think this is weird. I'd prefer to use navigatecontentwindow() with no
> URL---it always shows at 100% height and commits, and all suggestions call it
> (just queries have no associated URLs).

As we discussed offline with Shishir and David, let's do this like so for now.  We should reconsider how committing works in general once we're paste the M25 branch point.

messages.author: samarth
messages.text:
On 2012/12/12 04:15:20, samarth wrote:
> On 2012/12/11 16:43:48, Jered wrote:
> > Do you still want to call Submit() here?
> 
> Yes, actually the submit is needed here to commit the suggestion which was set
> using setValue().

Sorry, no, you're right -- we don't need an extra submit here.  Took it out.
